content.prompt: A sample of an ideal gas in a sealed container occupies a volume of 50.0L at 200K. The temperature of the gas is changed to 400K, and the pressure doubles. Which of the following must occur and why?

choices.label: Volume must decrease because the pressure is higher.
Volume must increase because the temperature is higher.
Volume must remain the same because the pressure and temperature change proportionately.
Volume cannot be predicted without knowing the number of moles of gas in the sample.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
